long_term_memory:
Project: Connsura insurance matchmaking app with React frontend and Node/Express backend.

Repo layout:
- connsura-frontend (React/Vite UI)
- connsura-backend (Express API + Prisma)
- automation (PowerShell + SSH deploy tooling)
- connsura-ai-system (docs and automation rules)
- memtool (project memory tooling)

Data model:
- PostgreSQL in staging and local dev via Prisma models: User, Agent, Customer, Message, Driver, Vehicle, AdminUser, AuditLog.
- User includes emailVerified boolean for OTP verification gating.
- Agent/Customer list fields are JSON strings (languages, states, products, coverages, etc).

APIs:
- Backend routes: /auth, /agents, /customers, /search, /quotes, /contact, /admin, /messages.
- Static: /uploads and /forms served by backend.

Deployment:
- Orchestrator: Windows 11 runs automation/master.ps1.
- Staging server: Ubuntu 22.04.5 LTS laptop, accessed via SSH.
- Nginx reverse proxy, Docker Compose for backend (8000) and frontend (4173).
- Domains: staging.connsura.com and api.staging.connsura.com.
- Deployment logs: /opt/connsura/deployments.log (server) and automation/deployments.log (local).

Decisions:
- PostgreSQL for staging persistence.
- Vite preview used for frontend in staging behind Nginx.
- Homepage hero and key sections now use a shared background image with a layered 3D gradient (bg-3d) and translucent cards.
- Create Profile page uses section-based modal forms with add/edit/remove and summary cards for household, address, vehicle, and business; only one section is visible at a time.
- Create Profile CTA opens customer auth modal and redirects to client dashboard Forms tab after login/signup.
- Profile sharing is gated by email verification (OTP).
- SSH + Playwright automation for provisioning and Squarespace DNS.

Open questions:
- Production environment and hosting plan not documented.
- Staging data seeding strategy not documented.
- Memtool embeddings require a valid OpenAI API key.

Next steps:
- Update memory after each deploy or major feature.
- If API key is available, index docs with memtool for embeddings.
